byline.contributor: Michael Schwirtz and Alex Vadukul contributed reporting, and Alain Delaquérière contributed research.
byline.original: By RICK ROJAS and BENJAMIN MUELLER

abstract: Driver Michael McBean is charged with manslaughter and leaving scene of fatal accident after running his car into retired New York Police Officer Yvette Molina in East New York, Brooklyn, and killing her; McBean attempted to flee scene, causing further traffic accidents and attempting to steal another driver's car along way.
lead_paragraph: The driver, Michael McBean, was charged after striking a Yvette Molina, 56, who died, and several stopped vehicles and then tried to flee, the police said.

headline.main: Driver Charged in Death of Retired Police Officer on Thanksgiving in Brooklyn
headline.print_headline: Driver Charged in Death of Retired Police Officer

snippet: The driver, Michael McBean, was charged after striking a Yvette Molina, 56, who died, and several stopped vehicles and then tried to flee, the police said.
